verb.description: Be aware of through observation, inquiry, or information.
examples: most people know that CFCs can damage the ozone layer

verb.description: Have developed a relationship with (someone) through meeting and spending time with them; be familiar or friendly with.

phrases: the senator's priorities do not add up and he knows it
They're breaking the goddamn law and they know it!
That's a lie and you know it!
Oh my God, Rachael, that's not what I meant and you know it!
by the year 2000 management as we know it will not exist
origin: Old English cnāwan (earlier gecnāwan) recognize, identify, of Germanic origin; from an Indo-European root shared by Latin ( g)noscere, Greek gignōskein, also by can and ken.
